trans-unit.source: Specifies that the designer for a class belongs to a certain category.
A visual designer can use a designer category to inform a development environment of the type of designer that will be implemented.
If no designer category is provided on a class, a development environment may or may not allow the class to be designed.
A category can be created for any name.
When you mark a class with this attribute, it is set to a constant member.
When you want to check the value of this attribute in your code, you must specify the constant member.
The Description column in the table below lists the constant member that each value is set to.
The DesignerCategoryAttribute class defines the following common categories: |Category|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |Component|Designers that are used with components.
The attribute is set to the constant member <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute.Component?displayProperty=fullName>.| |Form|Designers that are used with forms.
The attribute is set to the constant member <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute.Form?displayProperty=fullName>.| |Designer|Designers that are used with designers.

The attribute is set to the constant member <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute.Generic?displayProperty=fullName>.| |Empty String ("")|This is the default category.| For more information, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute"></xref> class with an empty string ("").
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DesignerCategoryAttribute"></xref> class with the given category name.
The name of the category.
Gets the name of the category.
The name of the category.
Specifies that a component marked with this category use a component designer.
This field is read-only.
To be added.
Specifies that a component marked with this category cannot use a visual designer.
This <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref> field is read-only.
This is the default category.
To be added.
Returns whether the value of the given object is equal to the current <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DesignOnlyAttribute"></xref>.
The object to test the value equality of.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value of the given object is equal to that of the current; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Specifies that a component marked with this category use a form designer.
This <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref> field is read-only.
To be added.
Specifies that a component marked with this category use a generic designer.
This <xref uid="langword_csharp_static" name="static" href=""></xref> field is read-only.
To be added.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Determines if this attribute is the default.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute is the default value for this attribute class; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a unique identifier for this attribute.
An <xref:System.Object> that is a unique identifier for the attribute.
